page.name: Session 1: Conclusion
page.content:
Summary

The key points covered in this session were:

  • WIOA emphasizes the need for adult education and literacy providers to deliver instruction that increases learners’ academic skills, and prepares them for successful transitions to postsecondary education, training, and employment, or advancement in the workplace. To this end, WIOA outlines a set of allowable workforce preparation activities to prepare learners for these educational and employment outcomes.
  • Workforce preparation activities are defined in WIOA as “activities, programs, or services designed to help an individual acquire a combination of:
    • basic academic skills;
    • critical thinking skills;
    • digital literacy skills; and
    • self-management skills, including competencies in

-  utilizing resources;

-  using information;

-  working with others;

-  understanding systems; and

-  obtaining skills necessary for successful transition into and completion of postsecondary education or training, or employment” (WIOA. 2014. Sec 203).

  • Workforce preparation activities are meant to be integrated into all levels of adult education services, regardless of whether the programming is designed to prepare students for a specific occupation or career pathway.

Continue to Session 2: Introduction to explore instructional resources for implementing workforce preparation activities in the classroom
